note.text: There are three chief types of interpretation. "Simultaneous interpretation" refers to a situation where a communication is interpreted at the same time as it is spoken.
In "consecutive interpretation," a speaker pauses at long regular intervals to allow the message to be interpreted.

"Escort interpretation," which is a form of consecutive interpretation, refers to the two-way interpretation of conversations between two or more individuals. Speakers pause frequently to allow the interpreter to repeat what has just been said. The defining trait of escort interpretation is its two-way nature.
